properties.name: Biggest Mausoleum in the US
properties.description: Posted by PdxadventureclubWell, at least it\'s one of the biggest. Has countless passageways with urn holes going back 100 years. They keep adding to it. Give yourself 3-4 hours for this one. It\'s Big.

properties.name: Bush Dogs
properties.description: Posted by Pdxadventureclub2 dogs sculpted out of bushes. They\'re really big and especially good when they\'re a little overgrown so they have some lift to them. After you\'re done, take some snacks and sit on Mt. Tabor for a little snack and rest.

properties.name: Catholic Bathrooms at Marylhurst
properties.description: Posted by PdxadventureclubDown the hall from the Art Gym is a non-gendered bathroom. In the bathroom there are stalls for both very small bathtubs and toilets. All the stalls are made out of some kind of plywood, and they have giant circles cut in them, which makes you think. "why are there even doors at all?"

properties.name: Glowing Greens Blacklight Miniature Golf
properties.description: Posted by Pdxadventureclub 509 Sw Taylor St, Portland, ORUnderground black light miniature golf. Fun to play in the almost dark but the holes are not very inventive. Recommendation: play second 9 and skip the glasses. Airbrush images are wild!

properties.name: Grotto-Sanctuary-Our Sorrowful
properties.description: Posted by Pdxadventureclub 8840 Ne Skidmore St, Portland, ORGiant dent in a cliff with religious stuff in it (lots of candles). Take an elevator (88948894 or sneak on) up to a nice wooded walk among the stations of the cross and the most sorrowful architecture around including a very blonde, blue-eyed Mary. The view is great.

properties.name: Hand-made House
properties.description: Posted by Pdxadventureclub There is a house that is very old and rickety with about 100 years of tinkering on it. It has been patched together and added onto so many times that it looks like a Seuss house. Wander around 27th and Clinton until you find a gravel alley. From the alley you can see the house.

properties.name: JESUS THE LIGHT OF THE WORLD
properties.description: Posted by Pdxadventureclub5601 S.E. Duke St. Portland, ORA big sign that says JESUS THE LIGHT OF THE WORLD. There is also a whole village of little huts that people pilgramage to to have naughty sex (we\'d like to think).

properties.name: Law Enforcement Supply Store
properties.description: Posted by Pdxadventureclub2714 NE Sandy Blvd, Portland ORThis one is a bit of a let down, but good for a rainy day when coupled with lunch.

properties.name: Oregon Vortex
properties.description: Posted by Pdxadventureclub 4303 Sardine Creek L Fork RDThey say, "The Oregon Vortex is a glimpse of a strange world where the improbable is the commonplace and everyday physical facts are reversed. It is an area of naturally occurring visual and perceptual phenomena, which can be captured on film". Well, maybe. The guided tour guides are robotic counter-culture youth of Medford or who-knows-where.

properties.name: Pavement Treatments on Broadway
properties.description: Posted by PdxadventureclubIf you walk along Broadway from the main Post Office to the fancy hotels, there are altered bicycle symbols in the bike lane on the right hand side.

properties.name: Self-Cleaning House
properties.description: Posted by PdxadventureclubThe self-cleaning house is an invention by Frances Gabe, a 92-year-old recluse with a loathing for housework. It is the only self-cleaning house in the world, though she\'s working on plans to sell to people who want their own cinder block self-cleaner. Warning: the house serves as a platform for Frances to talk your ear off about how Germans built everything in France, and her evil step-mother. Point of Interest: The housekeeper is very nice.

properties.name: Stolen Green Windmill
properties.description: Posted by PdxadventureclubThis was our first adventure. There was a windmill here that was really big and green and flopping over. It was stolen a few months ago. If you see it somewhere else, let us know.

properties.name: The Decorette Shop
properties.description: Posted by Pdxadventureclub 5338 SE Foster Road. Portland, ORTHE BEST cake decorating store ever. Features Portland\'s biggest selection of cookie cutters, weird cake toppers, big doilies to put under cakes. Most products in the store are from an indeterminate era, stocked somewhere between 1970-1992.

properties.name: The Hat Museum
properties.description: Posted by Pdxadventureclub  1928 Southeast Ladd Avenue, Portland, OR, 97214The real attraction here is Alyce, The Hat Museum\'s curator and tour guide. It seems impossible for someome to be so enthusiastic about hats. There are at least 15 pictures of her in the museum wearing hats. Big Pictures.

properties.name: The Velveteria
properties.description: Posted by Pdxadventureclub518 NE 20th Ave., Portland OROver 170 velvet paintings displayed salon style.

properties.name: Wrought Iron Fence X 10
properties.description: Posted by PdxadventureclubOn Harrold somewhere between 50th and 60th, there is possibly The World\'s Most Intricate Wrought Iron Fence. It is made by this one retired guy who does it to "stay busy." He was nice enough, but suspicious of our interest in the fence. If you take bus 10 to Foster, just look out the window on the left-hand side and you can\'t miss it.
